title: [5.0.11rc1] can not enable ldap on windows 2008 server
body:
expected behavior
enable ldap without issues

actual behavior
page spins and spins and never comes back

steps to reproduce
-- configure windows 2008 server with owncloud
--. enable â€œldap user and group backendâ€? app
-- configure ldap in admin page (example configuration)


![windows_ldap1](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/5174383/1058066/64433ee8-1181-11e3-996e-4a4a513e66f5.png)
![windows_ldap2](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/5174383/1058068/68564af2-1181-11e3-971f-55dcfaf9dce0.png)

  


--press â€œsaveâ€? on the screen above
--attempt to go to another page â€“ such as files or users
--notice the browser spins constantly and never comes back.  must restart iis on the windows server in order to get back into the owncloud web instance
--logs fill up with the following:	

{"app":"php","message":"readdir() expects parameter 1 to be resource, boolean given at c:\\inetpub\\wwwroot\\owncloud511\\lib\\cache\\fileglobal.php#72","level":2,"time":"2013-08-30t06:44:04+00:00"}

--logs continue to fill with the above message until iis is restarted.  even if the browser is closed, logs fill up.

--ldap is not totally configured at that time and users form ldap are not listed in the user database

note:
owncloud 5.0.10 was configured identically on the same windows 2008 server and has no issues
owncloud 5.0.11 was configured identically on ubuntu and has no issue
the issue seems to be related purely to owncloud 5.0.11rc1 running on the windows platform.

{"installed":"true","version":"5.0.15","versionstring":"5.0.11rc1"}
windows 2008 server

internet explorer 9, google chrome, mozilla firefox
